For Friday, Feb. 19

Posted by Brian Moseley

Tutorials (Feb. 15 and 16)

  1. For those of you that haven't passed the first keyboard skill: you'll have to play I–V(7)–I progressions in any major or minor key, using each of these three melodic scale degree patterns: 3-2-1, 1-7-1, and 3-4-3. Here's my video walking through this skill.
  2. Everyone will have to sight-sing a melody that highlights leaps to 4 and 6. In addition to the practice you're doing in class, you can find additional exercises in the Karpinski anthology, Chapter 26. And if you haven't passed the first sight-singing objective, you'll have to try that first.

As I mentioned in class, two things for tomorrow:

  1. Finish the sketch assignment I gave you last week. Here’s a copy if you need one.
  2. Complete a setting of the melody for string quartet. Here’s the melody:
